extendedInfo.description: Beautify your phone with this amazing live wallpaper inspired by some of the national symbols and sights of the Republic of China. Watch pictures of Chinese national flag and emblem together with the most famous tourist attraction - The Great Wall! The wallpaper also includes other symbols of the country such as the giant panda, folk toys or Chinese chopsticks! Get this application and enrich your phone with the traditional symbol of Chinese philosophy - Ying Yang! Enjoy this amazing live wallpaper for your phone!- Interactive background-Tap anywhere on the screen and new pictures will appear!- Full support for landscape mode and home-screen switching!Installation instructions:Home -> Menu -> Wallpapers -> Live Wallpapers  The flag of the People's Republic of China is red in color and it has five yellow stars. The color red symbolizes the spirit of the revolution, and the five stars signify the unity of the people under the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party.The design of the national emblem, published by the Central People's Government on September 20, 1950, shows Tiananmen under the light of five stars, and it is framed with ears of grain and cogwheel. The cogwheel and the ears of grain represent the working class and the peasantry respectively, and the five stars symbolize the solidarity of the various nationalities of China. The emblem clearly indicates that the country is a socialist state led by the working class and based on the alliance of the workers and the peasants.The Giant Panda is the national animal of the country. It's a mammal classified in the bear family, native to central and southern part of the country. It is easily known by its large, distinctive black patches around the eyes, ears and on its rotund body.The Dragon is the symbol of China's feudal monarchy. It is based on a 7,000-year-old legend, and has a horse's head, a snake's body and chook's claws. It represented the emperor's power during the years of the country's feudal system and it is also a sign of auspiciousness and wealth among the people.The Great Wall of China is the pride of the Chinese people. It was built between 5th and 17th century BC to protect the northern borders of the Chinese Empire during the rule of successive dynasties. The Great Wall is the world's longest man-made structure.Yin Yang symbol represents the primal opposing but complementary forces found in all things in the universe. Depicted as it is, it also outlines the necessity of balance in all things.
